reviews.text: At first glance this is just another Buddha. Once you walk around inside the building you realize, from the pictures on the wall, this is the remains of the original buddha from the Ayutthaya Era!! The outside building was built and renovated but there are pictures from when the outside of the building was in ruins like most of the temples in the city. I believe I read at the head and arms were put back on but the rest is still intact from that time!
I would have liked to have gone inside but it was closed. No reason was given as to why and security was unpleasant.
It's one of the oldest Viharn built in early Ayuttaya period. The original Buddha image was partially burned and damaged but has been being renovated to the current conditions. Worth a short visit.
20 bath entrance free and less tourist :) lots of chicken statue and real Buddhist monk that can pray for u inside . Plus another reclining Buddha !

Well, this is one of the well kept Buddha statues in this region. This statue was supposed to have moved from some location away long time back. Its still being worshiped by locals so you can see all the rituals performed to Buddha here, just like old times. Great place to visit and relax. There are street restaurants nearby to quench your thirst.

This city has so many beautiful areas and the ruins here and this temple is a big part of that. I believe this is the second biggest overall areas and home to the buddha head in the tree! If you're into history, this place provides a lot of that! If you love photography, this place will have plenty of things for you to shoot!

I can now understand why my friends in Thailand always like to return to this beautiful place. It's full of history, beauty, and personally a magical feel to it. Will definitely come back to see its magic at different time of the day or seasons.

This is an interesting complex and easily added to a visit to the Bang Pa-in Palace which is nearby. The site is interesting and, although it is not as well preserved as similar complexes around Siem Reap, restoration work is ongoing. Very good models near the entrance,  give the visitor an idea of the size and layout of the original site and its worth looking at these before starting your visit.

A Historical place. Must visit!! 
Took a cab for full day from hotel about $12. Calm and relaxing place. Makes you realize that there had been a time where people used to spend their daily life in their and now we are just visit imagining if we we there in our past life. 
Try Sai-mai!! You can find just across the street. It's a local sweet.

I cannot explain how wonderful walking and just appreciating this place. It speaks of spirituality and wonder. Though there are plenty of tourists, you can still find a quiet place to take everything in.

Three very impressive spiral structures surrounded by fairly spacious ruins. Well worth taking a slow walk all the way around to enjoy from all angles. It's a popular site so this would be a good one to hit first thing in the morning.

Unfortunately I wasn't able to go in and I know I missed out after looking at google maps and seeing just how big it is. There is much more to see than what I saw from the outside and I should of gone in! For me missing out I will give this place a 5 star
The most beautiful ancient temple in Ayutthaya!! Very hot but there are many big trees to hide from sunburn. I would recommend this place to the visitors who have a short stay to Ayutthaya!
I liked the his site. It is very beautiful and has a magic atmosphere. The three pagodas give a good impression of the former glory.  Worth visiting.

Don't forget to wear sunscreen, aside from the rich history of this temple, you should explore and treasure it's beauty by taking beautiful photos, the ruins will remind you that somewhere in the past, amazing things happened to be appreciated in the present time.

Still being renovated as of January 12.2019.
Doesn't look like it will be finished anytime soon. Not a lot so see right now
Sure it’s beautiful but under total renovation until February 2019 (if the works are completed on time). do not bother going there until then, all the temples and stupas are covered.
Small beautiful temple hiding in this  famous province. Quiet enough for relaxing after visiting the others busy place. I do love the old panting inside, so beautiful, must see!!!
Spiritual experience and an insight into the history and religious  culture of Thailand.
Unfortunately it is under repairing, can’t see Any thing
It still closed.if u have plan to be here recently,u can save ur time to visit other museums.
Old fashion
Interesting collection, infomative but small museum and very few to no visitors. Definitely worth a visit especially before doing temple sightseeing.
Good for those who don't know
Close for renovation.

A small peaceful place with some historic story. Only good if you want to learn about history. There are big boats show case around here. In the building, there is a small cafe for table inside. There are cows (a fake one) for picture spot.

While I personally was not aware of my country's involvement with Ayutthaya, I learned a lot of new facts and interesting stories from here. Entry was free unlike many other museums in Ayutthaya with two very friendly ladies welcoming you. I must admit that the location is a bit hidden away.
Very nice oasis to get quickly a good idea why the Dutch came here and what they did. Plus, good coffee and Dutch stroopwafels!
Cool museum.  Curious to learn more about the VOC

A little museum of Netherlands history on south east asia and Ayuddhaya, you will find how much Holland influenced over this region in the past, Beautiful building that align with a river, nice staff to take a good care of traveller and there is a cafe on ground floor too.
Beautiful old building and gardens. A small collection of Thai antiques in display worth visiting.

Boring museum, we payed waaay more then the locals. 
This was way more expensive then some of the beautiful temples.
Location in Ayutthaya the old capital city of thailand
Nice place
It was under construction when I visited there back to August 2018.

One of the greatest temple we've been to. Go here early so you can have nice shots. There's a traditional thai clothing rental outside the temple. a must try if you want to look like local on your pics.

Very impressive scale and of course interesting architecture and landscaping. They are ruins so done expect pristine condition but it didn't take much imagination to be impressed. If you're short on time I'd say it's ok to skip it for the more central locations but if you have the transport and especially a free morning to spare before the crowds arrive it's well worth a visit.

Worth going if you are in Bangkok. After having visited Angkor Wat I have to say I had great expectation for this place but it does not really compare as far as the size and quality if workmanship. The ruins are still very nice and one can appreciate the bas reliefs and stone work. Still a must stop.

As with most of the temple around Ayutthaya, one hour is more than enough to see this particular site. It is located quite far from the main set of three or four temples. You can get a Grab from the main set of temples, on the other hand renting a bicycle or scooter for the entire day might be more useful if you're planning on visiting lots of the temples further away. The temples itself aren't as glorious as the main central temples, on the other hand it is included as one of the 6 temples in the temple pass (220 baht, can be bought from any of the temple entrances that are included in the pass).

Thousands of temples, you could stay 3 days and visit half the structures. We managed to visit 3 temples so don't buy a full ticket, buy single tickets for each temple.
Rent a motorbike and have fun!

Thailand in general is the great country. I have to tell you about great weather in there and atmosphere is great too so if you want to check somewhere near or neat out. Thailand is a good choice i think.
Another amazing temple in Ayutthaya. A great place to explore the river behind the temple... boat hire 1000baht for an hour (total boat hire not per person)
Stop by feeding the fish in the river first time here, feel so peaceful, enjoying people sharing food to the fish and bird
Huge Buddha statue in an amazing room with adjoining rooms adorned with what seems as frescos. 1st stop on the Ayutthaya boat ride
Most of traveler visit this temple please give a highly respect for lord buddha and keep peaceful
A massive ancient temple that looks magnificent in real life. It was very well maintained, and had a tranquil atmosphere despite swarms of tourists (us included).

Wat Yai Chai Mongkhon (วัดใหญ่ชัยมงคล) or the Great Monastery of Auspicious Victory. The main Chedi here stands 62 meters high and took over 28,000 tons of bricks to construct. A chedi on each side with a large stone Buddha sits smiling face, near Ayutthaya Railway Station. 
Ticket: 20 Baht.
This place of devotion bustles with all walks of life. Make sure to go up the set of steps into a round room where you get to peer down a well. Throw in some coins and say a quiet prayer.
Nice old temple to visit but prepare for amount of tourists. It would be better to visit on normal days and avoid holiday time

One of many stunning temples in Ayuthaya well worth visiting. Personally I would recommend spending several days staying and cycling around the historical park as there is so much to see. Also you can visit inbetween all of the coach trips !

A small peaceful place with some historic story. Only good if you want to learn about history. There are big boats show case around here. In the building, there is a small cafe for table inside. There are cows (a fake one) for picture spot.

While I personally was not aware of my country's involvement with Ayutthaya, I learned a lot of new facts and interesting stories from here. Entry was free unlike many other museums in Ayutthaya with two very friendly ladies welcoming you. I must admit that the location is a bit hidden away.
Very nice oasis to get quickly a good idea why the Dutch came here and what they did. Plus, good coffee and Dutch stroopwafels!
Cool museum.  Curious to learn more about the VOC

A little museum of Netherlands history on south east asia and Ayuddhaya, you will find how much Holland influenced over this region in the past, Beautiful building that align with a river, nice staff to take a good care of traveller and there is a cafe on ground floor too.

It wasn't open when we were told it was, but! Nevertheless we still saw a majority of the sight with the help of our local guide it was quite the experience. Beautiful sun set and a miraculous feeling of walking in places where many stood before. The open burial site was creepily amazing.

The sign for this place is quite small. Come inside and you will see the place. It locates opposite from Japanese village but there is no boat service so, you have to come on the road over the bridge to another side. It's a historical and  peaceful place but not many ppl visit this place. On the day I visited, they have the demonstration for Roti Saimai (thai roti) so, we got to experience it but I dont think it's a regular service.

Feel depressed for this historical treasure. The village was deserted, none sign, none restoration, just bit of pictures on the board and whole load of skeleton to show that you came to the right place. Wish the involved party could take a look and promote this place more as for historical value.
A very interesting historic place. They have real skeletons and boards to read

reviews.author_name: อาชวิน อินทมี
reviews.text: not many cool history facts to see. By the way, it's open for free.

Great Local Night Market - we found it after taking a sunset boat trip - great street food - the eggy pancakes were superb, as were sweet pancakes, lovely fries, tasty little pasties(pastry and meat) and lots of sweet stuff! Clothes etc too.
Simple outdoor street market for food and goodies. Best smoothies in Thailand, visit Fateema Coffee and Fruit (40+ varieties) all fresh, made right there in front of you.
Very nice and authentic market.. a lot if food stands but also clothes and gear to buy.. worth a visit 👍🏼
Popular buffet vendor with rather cheap prices where locals keep buying from. Alternative meal choice if you're tired of having meal set and would like to eat like locals.
Great street food. Try the beef satay!
A market that you can find a lot of Thai food at a reasonable price. But need to find some place to eat them.
Perfect place with incredible Thai food.

The attitude is really bad.You can see they are wearing the green clothes,and they sell noodles and rice.Especially the women wearing leopard t-shirt was really the worst attitude I have ever met in Thailand.She told us to paid right now,and the others like the  locals can paid the bill when they finished eatting and she just smile to the locals.I don't know what's wrong with the women and the young man who  was wearing the green clothes.It's really the worst experience in Thailand.I strongly recommand that  you can just pass by this shop.Good luck and have fun in Ayutthaya.
Luv the fruit juice store! It's good to have something to drink, to eat before getting back to Bangkok
If you been traveling in Asia for some time and you come to this market you will be really disappointed.It is very small and no many different foot

Below average food for a Thai restaurant. Local dishes were also not on par. However wild boar was super spicy and good. Draft beer selection is limited to chang. They do they other options under bottles. Ambience and music were good ..I have edited this comment to 1 star after trying few other restaurants in the neighborhood.
They had amazing Thai coconuts. Although I’ve never had a coconut in Thailand that tasted bad. Fried rice can be improved. Grilled pork was not bad. Steamed fish was amazing.

One most favourite restaurant in Ayutthaya. This restaurant did serve real thai food with thai taste. Unlike any other restaurants serving not the original taste that Thai food should be. Highly recommended with very impressive price.
Nice food and view of the river. Pity the staff has an attitude towards foreigners. Ah well, no tip then.
Local restaurants, quite a lot of food menus. Because the location is on the edge of the river, most menus here are seafood. The price is not too expensive.
Authentic Thai food.  Family run.  Very affordable. Average of 40 THB per item.  Food was very spicy and hence a rating of 4. Otherwise I would have gone with a 5/5.

Very local in a clean neighborhood of the town. A very kind owner. We got a massive portion for 40 baths with warm rice! (Seriously doesn't happen often) totally recommend going there while you close by or just specifically to eat ( grab a songthaew running in inner circle of town at any spot and bizz to be drop of there) worth the trip vegeterian/vegan good!.
Nice staff. Good food.
在大城有素食喔！很便宜，衛生又美味
Günstiges Restaurant, gefunden durch die Happy Cow App. Super für Vegetarier und Veganer 👍🏻
The food was amazing but the service was poor. The cutlery and furniture did not do justice to the amazing location. The price was not worth the environment.
Super slow service. No service mind at all. Good river view. Food is expensive comparing to its quality and quantity. Not recommend or try once.
Perfecto!! Delicious food, Attentive service and nice view on chaopraya river. I love everything here and will come back to try more dishes and dessert 😘

We had cold spring rolls, not cooked properly, then a fish stir fry,  with the fins not properly removed, then a green curry which was very ordinary with fatty chicken. The vegetable stir fry was totally tasteless. Apart from this, the service was awful, with dishes brought out randomly and without the rice.
All this from a fairly expensive restaurant. Maybe just targeted at Chinese tourists.
Altogether the worst restaurant experience in Thailand!
Good but, No written pricing on river prawns... Annonced verbally at 1100thb/kg. I made repeat the price and i repeated price at order... Ordered 500g (2 pieces)... Charged at 1800thb/kg. Grrrrr
A massive ancient temple that looks magnificent in real life. It was very well maintained, and had a tranquil atmosphere despite swarms of tourists (us included).

Wat Yai Chai Mongkhon (วัดใหญ่ชัยมงคล) or the Great Monastery of Auspicious Victory. The main Chedi here stands 62 meters high and took over 28,000 tons of bricks to construct. A chedi on each side with a large stone Buddha sits smiling face, near Ayutthaya Railway Station. 
Ticket: 20 Baht.
This place of devotion bustles with all walks of life. Make sure to go up the set of steps into a round room where you get to peer down a well. Throw in some coins and say a quiet prayer.
Nice old temple to visit but prepare for amount of tourists. It would be better to visit on normal days and avoid holiday time

One of many stunning temples in Ayuthaya well worth visiting. Personally I would recommend spending several days staying and cycling around the historical park as there is so much to see. Also you can visit inbetween all of the coach trips !
